physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Large cutaneous and tendinous xanthomas identified in fingers, elbows, and knees. Thickness of Achilles tendons: 23 mm in the right and 28 mm in the left. Diagnosed with fatty liver by abdominal CT and ultrasonogram.
Developed coronary symptoms with significant stenoses found in coronary artery lesions by angiography.
Sister exhibited severe hypercholesterolemia with multiple cutaneous and tendinous xanthomas, muscle pain, and weakness diagnosed with polymyositis and fatty liver.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Polymyositis aggravated, leading to higher doses of corticosteroids and subsequent intestinal perforation and death.
